Dear video editor: stop cutting the video so soon

Science Channel has turned into worthless tabloid gossip. This video is a lot of fiction. First of all Diego Garcia is not the US military's most important base. Not even close. It's also not a secret. It's just remote. It is a very small island that is barely large enough to support an airfield and some other buildings. It's actually too far from almost anything to be an important base. It is however an airfield in the middle of a vast area without anywhere else to land. That's it's value. Few aircraft even operate out of that base because it is so remote. It has some strategic value as a base for surveillance aircraft monitoring ships in the Indian Ocean, which would be important to have if a conflict arose that involved a naval power in the region.

This is little better than CNN speculating that the plane was swallowed up by a black hole.

Oh, by the way. The US Navy has an official website for Diego Garcia available to the public.
https://cnic.navy.mil/regions/cnrj/installations/nsf_diego_garcia.html

You can read about the history of the island, it lists the units stationed there, the mission and a lot of other information. You can't call the base secretive by any measure. When the US military wants to keep a base secret, they don't talk about it, like the unnamed facilities in Nevada or Base X in the Middle East.
"The single most important and secret military base" not so secret now since everybody knows about it...
